arxiv_title: Nearly spanning cycle in the percolated hypercube
artifact_text:
\label{thm:main}
For every constant $\eps>0$, there exists a constant $C=C(\eps)>0$ such that, if $p=p(d)\in [0,1]$ satisfies $p\ge C/d$, then \whp $Q^d_p$ contains a cycle of length at least $(1-\eps)\, 2^d$.
query: Hamiltonicity and long/near-spanning cycles in random subgraphs of the hypercube $Q_d$ with edge retention probability $p$ (percolation on the discrete hypercube)
predicted_candidates: [{'reference': {'title': 'Hamilton cycles in random subgraphs of the hypercube'}, 'confidence': 0.7, 'reasoning': 'This title exactly matches the topic asked for (Hamiltonicity in random subgraphs of Q_d).
